column1: Student loan debt was already at a tipping point in America and has been totally exacerbated by the #COVID19  pandemic. I joined my colleagues in urging President Trump to do the right thing and continue the moratorium on payments until next year. Time is running out. https://t.co/yYktzI93wB

ATTN: If you have not received a #COVID19 stimulus check and are eligible to receive one the deadline to register online using the Non-Filers tool is tomorrow. Register here: https://t.co/tPnoBO6y4V https://t.co/ZhAqWfX6ox

.@CDCGov advises against traveling for the Thanksgiving holiday. My family cancelled Thanksgiving plans & my grandson’s first birthday which I was very much looking forward to. Due to #COVID19 you just can’t have even small gatherings. Stay safe and #WearAMask. https://t.co/XSilZoryiX

We need to extend the halt on evictions. @HouseDems have already passed a relief bill - twice - that included money for housing needs. Trump & @senatemajldr still refuse to help. #COVID19 is a public health emergency & it will only get worse if homelessness increases. https://t.co/JxQGVsZqp6
Security Summit partners warn taxpayers of new #COVID19-related text scam https://t.co/pxTy7dIOMk
We’re all depending on a #COVID19 vaccine so we can begin to fully recover. It’s unfortunate that it has become so politicized especially by the President. https://t.co/Lul5DaeETd

We have the worst #COVID19 mismanagement of any nation on earth. Trump literally could have saved tens of thousands of lives had he taken this virus seriously and acted just weeks earlier. https://t.co/CGJWHtWNin

HBCUs have historically been underfunded - especially in research. Yet institutions like @MeharryMedical have still been leading the fight against #COVID19 without equal access to funding. https://t.co/nyt6HLD5wW

The application for Metro CARES Act funds for live music venues & small businesses impacted by #COVID19 will be open at 10am CT tomorrow Oct. 14. Funds are limited & are first come first served so don’t wait. Application & more info can be found here: https://t.co/rzgD689Sec.

Small businesses including minority-owned businesses & nonprofits affected by #COVID19 can apply for a Supplemental Employer Recovery Grant. If your business received a grant through the TN Business Relief Program you still may be eligible. More info: https://t.co/8zBPs31rfM.

TN has hundreds of independent music venues. From Memphis to Mountain City we need to #SaveOurStages. They were the first to close due to the #COVID19 pandemic and will be the last to reopen. I fought hard for #SOS to be in the next #COVID19 relief bill. https://t.co/7YrD0u1lmI

The #IRS is sending letters to individuals who are eligible for #COVID19 stimulus checks with instructions on how to register to receive them. You DO NOT have to wait to receive a letter. You may register online by Oct. 15 using the Non-Filers tool: https://t.co/tPnoBO6y4V https://t.co/B09OpeNOi9
Families desperately need food stimulus checks and other relief while we battle the #COVID19 pandemic not more shameless self-promotion by this president. https://t.co/PYwME0oApY

The #IRS is sending letters to individuals who are eligible for #COVID19 stimulus checks with instructions on how to register to receive them. You DO NOT have to wait to receive a letter. You may register online by Oct. 15 using the Non-Filers tool: https://t.co/oTLCKWpKFQ https://t.co/EFyEhJ79cb

The deadline for small businesses to apply for #COVID19 relief funds from the Tennessee Business Relief Program has been extended to Sept. 30. See if your business is eligible here: https://t.co/GJz7qn2nUI
Middle Tennesseans call or text me about this every day. We have had the worst #COVID19 management of any nation.

The #SaveOurStages Act would provide $10 billion in relief for music venues while we face the #COVID19 pandemic. Some venues are at risk of closing their doors for good without this assistance. Who supports this bill from Tennessee? https://t.co/wx8BGPSqaN

Music venues and restaurants are at risk of closing their doors forever. The #RESTART Act gives these and other small businesses a vital lifeline to stay afloat while we face the #COVID19 pandemic. Why doesn’t the entire Tennessee delegation support this bill? https://t.co/TY9N5ZvR3T

Since the start of the #COVID19 pandemic there has been an increase of threats and attacks against Asian Americans. Today the House passed a resolution condemning the anti-Asian rhetoric and hate that has been fueled by President Trump. Bigotry and hate have no place in America. https://t.co/SOsX61SKfn

Zoos and aquariums are particularly vulnerable to financial ruin due to #COVID19. I joined my colleagues in urging leaders to include targeted relief for the @NashvilleZoo and others around the country. Zoos can’t stop caring for their animals because the economy is bad. https://t.co/CKT7EkFw4L

Nobody has access to presidents like Bob Woodward and Trump is already squirming. Nixon had Vietnam and Watergate but Trump’s negligence on #COVID19 has already given us more casualties than Vietnam Korea Iraq and Afghanistan. https://t.co/zk16KreEZr

Some TN small businesses that lost income as a result of COVID-19 mandatory closures are eligible for funding through the Tennessee Business Relief Program but the deadline to certify is coming up on Sept. 25.  To see if your business is eligible go to https://t.co/mlqOz72P3l.

Even though @CDCgov changed its guidance Nashvillians can still receive a #COVID19 test if you are asymptomatic. My colleagues & I sent a letter to Director Redfield asking him for the reasons behind this counterproductive decision that could lead to further spread of the virus. https://t.co/jjUpueVAPI

Early voting is one of the most critical tools we'll have in Nov. It makes it possible for eligible voters to safely participate in our democracy & limit #COVID19 health risks. By launching @VoteEarlyTN we are hoping participants will make voting a celebratory event for all! https://t.co/HHPFGYh4Ho

Even while we battle the #COVID19  pandemic the Trump Admin is still set on dismantling the ACA denying healthcare benefits to LGBTQ+ Americans. This policy was discriminatory and I’m glad to know the rule of law stands.   https://t.co/ycKE7YSuwy

The TN Community Cares Program is providing $150M in CARES Act federal funding to TN nonprofits that are responding to the #COVID19 pandemic but the deadline for to apply is THIS Saturday Aug. 15th. More info & the application can be found here: https://t.co/Y1bYw4Rzfp
|Tennessee must expand Medicaid to beat COVID-19 || Opinion https://t.co/bxm4OYVIyV via @tennessean|

We need to do everything we can to prevent hunger during the #COVID19 pandemic. I joined my colleagues @Ilhan & @chelliepingree in urging Sec. Perdue to renew waivers for school meal programs through the next school year. It’s the only meal some children have access to. https://t.co/QAhxY7PpH6

I have repeatedly called for expanding SNAP benefits to help families in need during #COVID19. Millions of Americans are already facing food insecurity and now the cost of groceries is RISING. https://t.co/0u4LTvi1EX

Thanks @yelyahwilliams! I support and have co-sponsored the #RESTART Act and #SaveOurStages. Our amazing venues artists and creators here in Music City need support as we battle COVID-19. https://t.co/Owu5Hm7TEB

It is unbelievable the TN Supreme Court is putting your health at risk. In the middle of a deadly pandemic the Court has ruled that fear of covid will not be a valid reason to vote absentee in the November election.

PPP works well for a lot of businesses. But many including independent music venues need a forgivable loan program that’s more flexible and targets the smallest of businesses. I urge House leaders to include the RESTART Act in the next #COVID19 stimulus package. https://t.co/6GwYxjylW8
The USPS is vital to ensure a safe election season this fall during the #COVID19 pandemic. The HEROES Act would give an additional $25 billion to USPS to continue operations. https://t.co/ClbVQurM0C

Tennessee’s handling of the #COVID19 pandemic has been disastrous. The state did not act soon enough to close things down then it moved too fast to open things up. The Governor still refuses a mask mandate even when the Trump administration advises that he order one. https://t.co/MF3jbJfGYk

The TN Dept. of Human Services needs to do more to help eligible families enroll in the P-EBT program. Families w/ children who receive free or reduced-price school meals may be eligible for financial assistance for previously missed school meals due to #COVID19.
Live music is the beating heart of Nashville but our independent venues have been hit hard by the #COVID19 pandemic.
Crazy talk from the White House while Americans are out of a job and losing loved ones due to #COVID19. Disgusting. https://t.co/gkDW6LnW31

Community Health Centers have yet to receive dedicated funding from @HHSGov’s  Provider Relief Fund. This #COVID19 relief funding was meant for all health care providers but CHCs and other safety-net providers who treat our most underserved Tennesseans still need support. https://t.co/iq57LvFTnw
Mitch McConnell’s #COVID19 package is dead on arrival. We need evictions stopped cold. Republicans do not understand real people with real problems.  https://t.co/F3XbkWO6WD

Despite tremendous interest TN is fighting a court ruling permitting #COVID19 as an acceptable excuse for voting absentee in Nov. @GovBillLee & @sectrehargett need to stop the anti-voting campaign & accept many Tennesseans will need to vote absentee in Nov. as we fight #COVID19. https://t.co/oXUJG5xCQq
As we continue to face the #COVID19 pandemic and tumultuous time in our country I’m reminded of the joy Art brings to our community.

It is vital to expand telehealth programs while we face the #COVID19 pandemic. The CARES Act gave resources to great institutions like @MeharryMedical & the HEROES Act would provide even more internet resources. The Senate needs to immediately pass the HEROES Act. https://t.co/UJsvIUJVcF

The CARES Act gave an estimated $650 million to local businesses that helped save more than 170000 jobs when the #COVID19 pandemic hit Middle TN. The funds are running out and businesses still need help. We need the Senate to immediately pass the HEROES Act. https://t.co/3brSFlN5oL

The federal government has been keeping the country afloat while we face the #COVID19 pandemic. Our schools health centers nonprofits and PEOPLE have received record aid. Unemployment benefits end this month unless the Senate acts and passes the HEROES Act ASAP. https://t.co/WaC8JPDu8F

We're recording the highest daily numbers of #COVID19 cases since the pandemic hit the U.S. From the start the White House prioritized Trump's re-election over science and public health. A colossal failure of national leadership. https://t.co/p0mHK9FuvS

The Trump administration is trying to hide everything because they don't want the American people to know how bad #COVID19 really is. This policy is dangerous and should be rescinded. https://t.co/PA95ZYzT6T
If you live in a nursing home according to @sectrehargett  you may not qualify for an absentee ballot – despite a judge’s ruling that anyone can apply for an absentee ballot due to #COVID19.
Nursing home residents are especially vulnerable to contracting #COVID19 so most are following health guidelines and not accepting visitors – i.e. election officials. https://t.co/OVwZNfA5Oh

Tennessee is being exposed as the 3rd worst state for voter suppression in the country. State officials should have followed the Nashville judge’s order to allow any Tennessean to vote via absentee ballot if they are afraid of #COVID19. The state did not comply. https://t.co/2Zzk89GaA1

Changing the Student and Exchange Visitor Program to punish international students at colleges universities and other institutions that have decided to move their courses online in order to protect their communities from #COVID19 is callous.
ICYMI: @NIHDirector Dr. Francis Collins & @NIAIDNews Director Dr. Anthony Fauci gave a research update on #COVID19 and answered some important questions. Watch here:  https://t.co/bp1B3Wrt3n

HBCUs were already operating on tight budgets and #COVID19 has exacerbated the problem. Congress should pass the HBCU Capital Finance Debt Relief Act so that our awesome HBCUs have more money to support students. https://t.co/yJZMhvwYrC
Congress must address rising food insecurity in America. I joined my colleagues to urge House and Senate leaders to boost SNAP benefit levels during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/VTPZRjenGk

Minority communities are taking the brunt of the #COVID19 pandemic here in Nashville. They have less access to health care & are more likely to get exposed as the country reopens. We must prioritize funding to decrease health disparities & support our most vulnerable people. https://t.co/3oRsdCanaz

Every race gender and ethnicity should be represented in #COVID19 vaccine trials. We already know the virus affects people differently and it is the only way we will ensure the vaccine protects all communities. https://t.co/SxGGROTZRs

Child care is more important than ever as parents and guardians begin returning to work. We need to substantially increase our investment in safe and affordable child care as we face the #COVID19 pandemic which is why I cosponsored the Child Care for Economic Recovery Act. https://t.co/i1jXLDWYLv
I supported the bipartisan CARES Act and am proud that it provided so much needed aid to our hospitals including @NashGenHospital during this time of #COVID19.  https://t.co/S8yvx6smo3

The #COVID19 pandemic has impacted everyone in our country and communities of color are being harmed disproportionately by this crisis. We must tackle these health disparities directly and prioritize policies in an equitable and just way. https://t.co/ful1229ffG

We know voting by mail works and a recent Stanford study proves it doesn’t favor either political party. It is even more essential as we face the #COVID19 pandemic. Read the study here: https://t.co/rxQyIOHhuA.

Community Health Centers provide care for our most medically vulnerable individuals & Middle TN has some of the best CHC facilities in the country. We must support them as we fight the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/XX5yaGvxUq

I agree - I voted for the HEROES Act which has $75B for testing and contact tracing in addition to fixing PPP and hundreds of billions in funding for state-local gov’ts to help with COVID expenses and replace lost revenue. The Senate won’t vote on it. https://t.co/s0C5wnM0QS
3/4: We have passed four #COVID19 relief bills with near unanimous support in both the House and Senate but Republicans now seem more intent on saving their election chances than saving America.

The #COVID19 crisis continues to hit the vibrant arts & cultural scenes hard. Places are closed & artists performers & others who are temporarily employed & on contract freelance or self-employed are especially vulnerable. This big part of Nashville is hurting & needs help. https://t.co/drWisdnswa

Schools have been hit hard by the #COVID19 crisis. Costs for technology training student meal distribution & cleaning services have increased exponentially. The K-12 system needs federal funds to provide schools w/ the needed lifeline to retain their workforce & serve students. https://t.co/E6iysqKm4G

Initial timelines & limits put in place for small business assistance programs need revision as we face the #COVID19 crisis. I’ve heard from several Middle TN businesses that need flexibility as they start to reopen. https://t.co/DhEGkhsqS4

No one should worry about feeding their family while we face the #COVID19 crisis. I'm proud to cosponsor the FEED Act introduced by my colleagues @SenKamalaHarris @SenatorTimScott @RepMcGovern @RepThompson  @RodneyDavis & @chefjoseandres. Help us feed America & #EndHungerNow. https://t.co/Qg3Z8uql0o

Homeowners should be able to defer missed payments to the end of a mortgage period while we face the #COVID19 crisis. Payments should be made at the same evenly-distributed intervals as prior payments – w/ no penalties late fees or additional interest. https://t.co/5YBvytKg3X

DREAMers are hard workers and many are going to college. They represent the best of America and shouldn’t be denied stimulus relief to help with unexpected expenses caused by #COVID19 because of their immigration status. https://t.co/SBwiVh27Lp

The Emergency Economic Injury Grants & EIDL Injury Disaster Loans (EIDL) were meant to provide help to small businesses & non-profits impacted by #COVID19 within 3 days of an application. Small businesses are waiting & it is unacceptable that people cannot get status updates. https://t.co/hNIeiYrLCC

Ten years ago Nashville pulled together with neighbor helping neighbor and strangers helping strangers. We rebuilt our community together then and are working on rebuilding together again as we face the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/U33n6G4Rkm

Ongoing testing isolation monitoring & contact tracing is necessary to contain the spread of #COVID19 until we have a vaccine. The actual number of Americans who have been exposed to or infected is still unknown. https://t.co/COGRoDGuIJ

Research for a #COVID19 vaccine is in overdrive. Most other research has been slowed or stopped due to closures of college campuses & laboratories. Congress must preserve our current scientific workforce & ensure the U.S. is prepared to continue our global scientific leadership. https://t.co/jDG5kCq7JQ

Tennessee has had limited mail-in voting for generations and President Trump voted in the last election by mail. So why not expand mail-in voting now when we need it most so that voters and poll-workers can stay safer from the #COVID19 virus? https://t.co/nd2oRPEsum

Arts & cultural organizations have been hit hard by social distancing & stay-at home orders. It could be months before we go to the concerts plays or museums that make up a big part of Nashville. No one wants them closed forever due to #COVID19. https://t.co/WmdtYuN6i9

Social Security recipients & low-income families may not get the $500 stimulus payment if they failed to complete a form by noon Wed. only 3 days after the #IRS notified the public of the deadline. An extension will support families as we try to slow the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/j3pVkoHBrd

The Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) builds a bridge from where we were prior to the #COVID19 crisis to where we are going to be. Congress must remove arbitrary funding barriers fully fund the PPP & ensure every eligible entity receives the funds and flexibility they need. https://t.co/Xd9JKdXlhU
8 In 10 Americans Support COVID-19 Shutdown Kaiser Health Poll Finds https://t.co/N0CCKL3tDP

This is the latest COVID-19 relief effort which follows the largest economic relief bill in America’s history. We also know that it doesn’t help everyone or every small business that needs it. We will begin to work on the next relief bill right away. https://t.co/xTjzhCU6ev
I am going into the Capitol to vote for the next wave of #COVID19 relief funds. https://t.co/BDZA6AmNnO
I am approaching the Capitol to go vote for the next wave of #COVID19 relief funds. More later. https://t.co/aHDSsniatt

With nearly a million uninsured Tennesseans prior to the #COVID19 crisis & millions more Americans filing for unemployment each week we must protect Medicaid. This lifeline provides health care coverage for those who need it most.
If you recently lost your health insurance or had a change in your income due to #COVID19 you may qualify for a special enrollment period for health insurance: https://t.co/RU7KQ2gpYp

American families need these stimulus checks to help them get through the uncertain economic conditions caused by the #COVID19 pandemic. Bad actor lenders and private debt collectors should not be allowed to intercept or garnish these payments that families need. https://t.co/ixNNEOITj7

Urging every American to do their part & wear a mask in public is an important way @CDCgov can continue to slow the spread of #COVID19. @fema is working on supply chains & one should be available for every American while ensuring health care providers receive what they need. https://t.co/AsWgkUQ2xX

College students home due to #COVID19 should NOT be included on their parents’ #2020Census. If the student lived off campus they respond as though they are at that location. If they lived on campus they will be counted by the school. Questions? Visit https://t.co/5uUFWBf4An.

I joined 92 colleagues to request $125 billion in housing assistance in the next stimulus package. This helps landlords stay solvent; shelters that are overwhelmed; and renters and low-income families who are worried they might lose their home due to the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/IssVU5JphH

Families could lose thousands of dollars they put away for daycare summer camps or before/after-school care due to #COVID19. I joined a letter asking @USTreasury & #IRS to revise their use-it-or-lose-it rules & give flexibility to families for their dependent care funds. https://t.co/7KerG8tsE6

This is brazen voter suppression. Every vote should be counted and this is a terrible precedent to set while we face the #COVID19 pandemic. People should not have to choose between their lives and their vote. https://t.co/2hMXZ3nFLy

Students & families are already struggling to meet basic needs – including food housing & health care. Safeguarding students’ rights is important and @usedgov should not gut Title IX funding during the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/jOh02upsff
Some states still aren’t taking the COVID-19 pandemic seriously enough and too many lives are at risk which is why a national stay-at-home order is needed.
The EPA’s reckless decision to roll back enforcement actions during the #COVID19 pandemic puts all Americans’ health at risk & creates a dangerous precedent for future national emergencies.

Coronavirus is an unprecedented pandemic and this is an unprecedented bill. It is the largest economic relief bill passed in America’s history.

1/4: It is unacceptable that American patients and doctors have to use Google to find answers about coronavirus and test kits.

TN has its first confirmed case of coronavirus (COVID-19). Williamson Co. Schools are closed tomorrow & Monday. Please refer to @CDCgov & @TNDeptofHealth for more info. You can also visit my website which includes the same info: https://t.co/PNEmZ3IPNC. https://t.co/OzrlCHDc3C
For up-to-date info on the coronavirus visit the CDC website: https://t.co/qkNqQkrEbQ.  You can also visit my website which includes the same info: https://t.co/PNEmZ3IPNC. https://t.co/vDyJIaxwh5
